text: Say I have a sequence of numbers (x_1, ... x_7) and I want to form the polynomial (x_7 t + (x_6 x_1 + x_5 x_2 + x_4 x_3) t^2 + (x_1 x_2 x_4) t^3) (i.e. all the coefficients sum to 7 and it the power of the polynomial tells you how many you have). What's the algebraic name for that. I know I've seen the construction before, but my memory is failing me. It's probably some sort of exterior algebra inner product.

elements.text: Say I have a sequence of numbers (x_1, ... x_7) and I want to form the polynomial (x_7 t + (x_6 x_1 + x_5 x_2 + x_4 x_3) t^2 + (x_1 x_2 x_4) t^3) (i.e. all the coefficients sum to 7 and it the power of the polynomial tells you how many you have). What's the algebraic name for that. I know I've seen the construction before, but my memory is failing me. It's probably some sort of exterior algebra inner product.

text: Did you ever figure it out? <@U7KA5J01Y> might have an idea

elements.text: Did you ever figure it out?

text: No, I don't not. But I also got the construction wrong
